This indicator refers to the ratio of accounts with net long positions to those with net short positions among the top 5% of traders with the largest open position value.

trade_charts_textarea_desc_psychological:
This indicator calculates the ratio of rising periods to the total number of periods. It represents the balance between buying and selling pressures in the market.
PSY > 50% suggests that buyers dominate the market, indicating bullish sentiment. PSY < 50% suggests that sellers have the upper hand, indicating bearish sentiment.

trade_charts_textarea_desc_index:
This indicator is a line that connects the index price of each candlestick on a chart. Each candlestick can be constructed using the last price, index price, or mark price. 
The indicator provides a visual representation of the index price’s movement in relation to the candlestick’s chosen data.

trade_charts_textarea_desc_desc_pos_ls_r:
This indicator refers to the ratio of total long position value to total short position value among the top 5% of traders with the largest open position value.

Long/short ratio (Positions) = Total long position value / Total short position value
trade_charts_textarea_desc_directional_m: This indicator measures the strength of a trend and potential trend reversal. PDI measures the strength of upward price movements. MDI measures the strength of downward price movements. ADX quantifies the strength of the overall trend. ADXR smoothens ADX. The ADXR was developed to compensate for the variance of excessive tops and bottoms.

trade_charts_textarea_desc_relative_stre: This indicator measures the speed and change of price movements, indicating overbought or oversold conditions.
trade_charts_textarea_desc_different_ma: This indicator calculates the difference between two moving averages to identify trend direction and potential entry or exit points. DMA represents the current value of the moving average difference, while AMA represents the moving average of the DMA line.

trade_charts_textarea_desc_stochastic_os: This indicator is a momentum oscillator that compares the closing price to the price range over a specific period, indicating overbought or oversold conditions. K represents the percentage of the current price relative to the highest price over a specific period. D represents the simple moving average of K. J represents the percentage of the current price relative to the lowest price over a specific period.
